titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Connor and Neff blues collection
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Anne Rhodes

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday June 27, 2025 at 10:19

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Connor and Neff Blues Collection consists of 96 interviews with various blues musicians and blues industry figures. These interviews were the basis for the 1975 book The Blues by Anthony Connor and Robert Neff.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by surname of interviewee.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. To request access to recordings or transcripts of interviews (if available), see OHAM's website.
Some interviews may be restricted. Access to these restricted interviews may only be granted to a patron who has first obtained direct permission from the interviewee or their estate.
Some interviews may not have been digitized or are otherwise not available to stream online.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Rights and permissions for OHAM materials vary between individual interviews. Researchers wishing to publish or broadcast OHAM materials are responsible for obtaining direct authorization from copyright holders: generally, the interviewees or their estates.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: BL, Connor and Neff Blues Collection, Oral History of American Music, in the Music Library of Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape also contains live footage of Willie Dixon's band.

did.unittitle: Shaw, Eddie and Emery "Detroit Junior" Williams, Jr.
Shaw, Eddie and Emery "Detroit Junior" Williams, Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Band members, Calvin "Fuzz" Jones, Hollywood Fats, and Mojo Buford, are also present.
